answer.body: Admin Day is a day organised for all P1 parents/guardians to purchase books and school uniforms.

questionListItems.title: Who is eligible to register for P1 this year?

answer.body: Children born from 2 Jan 2017 to 1 Jan 2018 (both dates inclusive) are eligible to register for P1 this year.

questionListItems.title: After my child has successfully secured a place in QtPS, what are the key dates I will need to take note of?

answer.body:
Parents/guardians of children who have successfully secured a place in QtPS should keep the following dates free:

  • Admin Day (October 2023, date to be confirmed)

  • P1 Orientation Day (November 2023, date to be confirmed)

The school will advise parents/guardians on the confirmed dates and platforms for these events through your mailing address closer to the date.

questionListItems.title: I will be overseas during the P1 Registration exercise. How do I register?

answer.body: Please refer to the MOE P1 registration website at https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration. All registration will be done online.

questionListItems.title: Is the P1 Registration result based on a first come, first served basis?

answer.body: No. Other than Phase 1 of the registration, results for the other phases are based on the location of Singapore Citizens (less than 1km / 1-2km / over 2km), Singapore Permanent Residents (less than 1km / 1-2km / over 2km), and International Students.

questionListItems.title: Which schools qualify for P1 Registration 2A in QtPS?

answer.body: Queenstown Primary School, Tanglin Primary School and Mei Chin Primary School.

questionListItems.title: What are the different phases of the P1 Registration exercise? What supporting documents do I need to register?

answer.body: Please refer to the MOE P1 registration website at https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/registration-phases-key-dates

questionListItems.title: Does QtPS offer a parent volunteering scheme for P1 registration purposes?

answer.body: No. Parents/guardians can join the Queenstown Parent Support Group (QtPSG) after their child/ward has successfully secured a place in the school for the coming academic year.

questionListItems.title: What are the chances of securing a place in QtPS?

answer.body: The P1 registration differs from year to year. Parents/guardians may monitor vacancies in the school via MOE's website during the P1 registration exercise. For the past two years, balloting has occurred in Phase 2C.

questionListItems.title: When can parents/guardians apply for MOE Financial Assistance Scheme (FAS)?

answer.body: Application link for MOE eFAS will be available online. Information will be provided via the 1st P1 Welcome Letter that will be sent to you via your mailing address. Approval and collection of school books and uniforms will be in November (tentatively).

questionListItems.title: How many P1 classes do you have in QtPS, and how many students are there in each class?

answer.body: We have 7 P1 classes, with a maximum of 30 students in each class.

questionListItems.title: Where are the P1 classrooms located?

answer.body: Primary 1 classrooms are located on the first and second levels.

questionListItems.title: How are students allocated to classes in P1?

answer.body: Students are allocated to respective classes based on the equal distribution (as best as possible) of students of different genders, races, and ethnicities.

questionListItems.title: How many Form Teachers does each class have?

answer.body: Each class has 2 Form Teachers who teach the class different subjects.

questionListItems.title: I wish to understand more about my child's progress in school. Who should I contact?

answer.body: You may email your child's form teachers. Form Teachers can be reached either through ClassDojo or email. Your child's Form Teachers' email addresses can be found on Parents Gateway.

agencyTopics.title: Daily Concerns: School Bag, Recess, Etc
Services: Student Care Centre & School Bus
